verbose_text: The IL-7-induced increase in the number of IELs may be associated with the increased rate of IEL proliferation observed by immunofluorescence; however, the expression level of the IL-7 protein was found to be decreased in IECs following I/R for 6 h. IL-7 affects T-cell sensitivity through the expression of CD127, and it is possible that the availability of IL-7 is limited in vivo.
